channel.title: Win vista
channel.description: Hey guys I have a pc with win 7 its designed for windows vista its got 4gigs ram and a 2 gb video card currently only have 128mb if i put vista back on it will it open the video card a little more?

item.title: Win vista
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Might want to check into it because for there is suposidly a patch for extended service until 2019.

Read full topic

item.title: Win vista
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:25, topic:547561”][quote author=RUNE-PK link=topic=666469.msg4456064#msg4456064 date=1414971891]

XP was shit when it first came out. Made bills from it.

Are you… Are you serious? It is/was one of the most stable OS’s Windows has released…
I can’t remember exactly, but when the windows XP support ended with microsoft (recently) some company or government paid microsoft a grip of money to get continued support…

What are you talking about?

I work for the government, there was no payment to Microsoft for continued support. We were told to get over ourselves and handle our own problems until we upgrade. The one thing you have to realize about government is that we are slow as all get out when it comes to getting anything done. I.e. we have had desktops in our storage units that have I7’s in it for over a year and we still haven’t installed them at the stations at work LOL.

Welcome to the government.

You worked or the goverment wow im sorry about what i said lol I didnt know
[/quote]
I work a government job as well. Sadly most government PCs still run XP. What little computers run Win7 or Win8 go down far more often than any of our old XP units.[/quote]
And to note, I wasn’t talking about the american gov’t.
L&P got mixed up with my wording.
The UK bought extended service till April 2015 for some like 5.8 million eruo’s.

Read full topic

Welcome to the government.

You worked or the goverment wow im sorry about what i said lol I didnt know[/quote]
I work a government job as well. Sadly most government PCs still run XP. What little computers run Win7 or Win8 go down far more often than any of our old XP units.

item.title: Win vista
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“TrisidiaX, post:12, topic:547561”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=666469.msg4455995#msg4455995 date=1414944602]

No, Windows Vista was a complete flop compared to Windows 7. Win7 has far better performance all around in my findings.

That’s because windows vista, like windows 8, was made on the “shitty release year”.
There’s a trend microsoft seems to have where every other year they release a good OS, and the other is a shit OS.
Windows XP - Good.
Windows Vista - Shit.
Windows 7 - Good.
Windows 8 - Shitty in ways…
Windows 8.1 - Improvements on the shitty parts of 8.
Windows 9 - Non-existent due to poor programming in earlier code.
Windows 10 - Hopefully a good version of windows 8.
[/quote]

What about windows 98? Lol.[/quote]
What about it?

Read full topic
